en.opening-cinematic-1: In this game you're going to help an animal fulfil its needs!
en.opening-cinematic-2: In order to do that we must first understand what is animals life processes.
en.opening-cinematic-3: Animals need energy to perform their life processes.
en.opening-cinematic-4: The energy in an animal’s food was once energy from the Sun that was captured by plants.
en.hunt-1-opening-1: This is Mr. Fox, and he needs food for energy.
en.hunt-1-opening-2: Mr. Fox is a carnivore so he only eats meat.
en.hunt-1-opening-4: Hold down Mr. Fox and flick him like a catapult to hunt the rabbits
en.hunt-1-success-1: Good job! Now hunt more rabbit to complete the level!
en.hunt-1-complete-1: Nice work now Mr. Fox is having a feast!
en.eat-1-opening-1: Mr. Fox is hungry, lets give him the rabbit meat!
en.eat-1-opening-2: Drag and drop the meat on Mr. Fox's mouth, tap Mr. Fox to chew.
en.energy-1-opening-1: As you can see, stored chemical energy is released when food is digested.
en.energy-1-opening-2: The chemical energy in food can be transformed into motion energy that allows an animal to move its body.
en.energy-1-opening-3: Let's distribute the energy to Mr.Fox's body! And let's see what happens next.
en.energy-1-opening-4: Let's connect the energy in order!
en.energy-1-complete-1: In the process of metabolism, food is broken down into forms of energy that can be used for an animal’s growth.
en.energy-1-complete-2: Mr. Fox has grown stronger! good job!
en.second-cinematic-1: Let's see, what else can energy provide for Mr. Fox.
en.second-cinematic-2: Uh-oh, looks like Mr. Fox is hurt! But not that badly, let's hunt more rabbits!
en.hunt-2-opening-1: Lookout not to hit trees and rocks, Mr. Fox doesn't like being hurt
en.eat-2-opening-1: Uh-oh! Watch out! it's a poisonus mushrooms!
en.eat-2-opening-2: You can discard it into the trash can!
en.energy-2-opening-1: Let's distribute the energy to Mr. Fox's body! And let's see what happens next.
en.energy-2-complete-1: As we can see here, stored energy also can be used for an animal's body repair.
en.hunt-3-opening-1: Looks like snows are falling! Mr. Fox has to gather food to stock up in the winter.
en.hunt-3-opening-2: But don't worry Mr. Fox is an endotherm animal.
en.hunt-3-opening-3: Endotherms are animals that use energy in food to maintain their body warmth when the temperature in the environment changes.
en.hunt-3-complete-1: Nice work! Now let's eat up!
en.eat-3-complete-1: Great now let's distribute the energy once more!
en.energy-3-opening-1: Let's distribute the energy so Mr.Fox can warm up.
en.energy-3-complete-1: Well done! Mr.Fox is feeling comfy right now!
en.ending: Great job! You have witness an animal life processes, and suceeded to help Mr.Fox fulfill his needs! Thank you for helping!
